title: Mum quits her job after nursery expels foul-mouthed daughter
text:
If there’re two things Lottie loves doing, it’s climbing and swearing (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

An exhausted mum has quit her job to look after her unruly and foul mouthed daughter who was excluded from nursery for her bad behaviour.

Three-year-old Lottie’s loves climbing on furniture, giving her mother Joanne the finger and freely using the ‘f word’.

She appeared on Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery on 5star last night, a new series examining the complex world of child psychology.

Joanne called her daughter a ‘danger to herself’, who frequently scales kitchen sinks, window sills and chairs and breaks away from her mum to dart across the road.

She said: ‘I don’t get a minute, I need eyes all around her. She doesn’t care about consequences, you can take her away from the situation, and she’ll just go back and do exactly the same.’

Her mum says she worries about her daughter putting herself in harm’s way (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

Child psychologist Laverne Antrobus said Lottie just wants to explore the world by touching and feeling (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

Lottie often breaks away from her mum to run across the road (Picture: (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

She will climb anything and ‘doesn’t care about consequences’ (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

The frustrated mum says it makes no difference if she tries to discipline her daughter, who has been kicked out of nursery because of her reckless antics.

She says she was getting called up to three times a week to come to pick Lottie up.

Tearing up about the prospect of her daughter hurting herself one day, Joanne said: ‘You think, “what have I done wrong?” I’m absolutely exhausted with it all.’

Joanne says her daughter craves constant attention and she struggles to figure out what makes her tick.

But after a few days observing Lottie’s behaviour at nursery, the psychologists gave some insight into what makes her put herself in harm’s way.

Joanne had to quit her job after Lottie was booted from nursery (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

Joanne admits struggling to keep up with her toddler’s antics (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

She says she is ‘absolutely exhausted with it all’ (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

Child psychologist Laverne Antrobus said the toddler ‘enjoys quite a thrill from climbing and exploring in this way’ and also likes the reaction it gets her from adults.

Colleague Jess Elmer added: ‘I guess her sense of danger and understanding of risks is not quite there yet.’

The pair advised Joanne to create a safe environment for Lottie to allow her to carry on learning about the world around her by touching and feeling things.

During the show Lottie was given several boxes full of jelly to experiment with, which she touched which she happily touched with her feet and hands.

Psychologists recommended crafting a safe area for her to learn in her own way (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery with Psychologists Lavere and Jess and teachers Jules and Lucy airs on Thursdays (Picture (Picture: 5Star/Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery)

She appeared to find it easier focusing on tasks with something in her mouth.

Rather than letting Lottie chew on bottle lids as she usually does, Laverne and Jess suggested safer alternatives.

Britain’s Naughtiest Nursery airs on Thursdays on 5Star.
